Description: A unique identifier assigned to each patient (4751 to 6900).
The age of the patients ranges from 60 to 90 years.
Gender of the patients, where 0 represents Male and 1 represents Female.
The ethnicity of the patients, coded as - 0: Caucasian, 1: African American, 2: Asian, 3: Other
The education level of the patients, coded as - 0: None, 1: High School, 2: Bachelor's, 3: Higher
Body Mass Index of the patients, ranging from 15 to 40.
Smoking status, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
Weekly alcohol consumption in units, ranging from 0 to 20.
Weekly physical activity in hours, ranging from 0 to 10.
Diet quality score, ranging from 0 to 10.
Sleep quality score, ranging from 4 to 10.
Family history of Alzheimer's Disease, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
Presence of cardiovascular disease, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
Presence of diabetes, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
Presence of depression, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
History of head injury, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
Presence of hypertension, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
Systolic blood pressure, ranging from 90 to 180 mmHg.
Diastolic blood pressure, ranging from 60 to 120 mmHg.
Total cholesterol levels, ranging from 150 to 300 mg/dL.
Low-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels, ranging from 50 to 200 mg/dL.
High-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels, ranging from 20 to 100 mg/dL.
Triglycerides levels, ranging from 50 to 400 mg/dL.
Mini-Mental State Examination score, ranging from 0 to 30. Lower scores indicate cognitive impairment.
Functional assessment score, ranging from 0 to 10. Lower scores indicate greater impairment.
Presence of memory complaints, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
Presence of behavioral problems, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
Activities of Daily Living score, ranging from 0 to 10. Lower scores indicate greater impairment.
Presence of confusion, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
Presence of disorientation, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
Presence of personality changes, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
Presence of difficulty completing tasks, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
Presence of forgetfulness, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
Diagnosis status for Alzheimer's Disease, where 0 indicates No and 1 indicates Yes.
This column contains confidential information about the doctor in charge, with "XXXConfid" as the value for all patients.
